text: there's a stark warning tonight that
millions of children in Yemen could be
pushed to the brink of starvation
unless international aid is dramatically
stepped up
it comes from UNICEF the United Nations
children's organization the country
faces the world's worst humanitarian
crisis with the covert 19 pandemic
compounding the effect of five years of
civil war Houthi rebels backed by Iran
have been fighting Yemen's government
itself backed by a saudi-led coalition
which is supported by the US and the UK
two million of Yemen's children are
malnourished and 1.7 million have been
forced to flee their homes with only
half of the country's health facilities
in operation one child dies every 10
minutes from a preventable disease our
middle east editor Jeremy Bowen sent
this report and I must warn you there
are distressing images right from the
start
Salwa Allah Dhabi is 5 the same age as

her father Ibrahim says they can't pay

CEL was not the only one

proportions making everything worse
separatists are fighting a new war to
end South Yemen's union with the north
it's on top of Saudi Arabia's

that's all they have in this war and
